intro: Calawaya elata, commonly known as the slender calawaya, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
